author: Ryan Daws
description:
Security researchers at Veracode, during their routine monitoring of the open-source world, stumbled upon two seemingly harmless software packages on the popular npm repository. However, when they looked inside, they weren’t greeted with code; instead, they faced a wall of Unicode characters, predominantly in Japanese Katakana and Hiragana. “What started as an investigation into a... Read more »

The post Veracode unravels 12-layer npm attack to find RAT appeared first on Developer Tech News.
title: Veracode unravels 12-layer npm attack to find RAT
